channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Your Favorite Sex Toy Brand Might Go Under
item.description: There’s still a 145 percent tariff on China, and sex toys aren’t part of the electronics exemption.

item.title: Apple details how it plans to improve its AI models by privately analyzing user data

item.title: A New Mexico Man Faces Federal Charges for Allegedly Setting Fire to a Tesla Showroom
item.description: Jamison Wagner was also charged with an alleged arson attack on the New Mexico Republican Party’s office.

item.title: RLWRLD raises $14.8M to build a foundational model for robotics

item.title: How to Watch the Lyrids Meteor Shower

item.title: Marshmallow, the UK insurance startup for migrants, raises $90M at a $2B+ valuation
item.description: U.K. startup Marshmallow has blown up over the years by using innovations in data science to build car insurance policies for immigrants and other con...

item.title: Waymo and Uber prepare to launch robotaxi service in Atlanta this summer

item.title: ‘We Are Not Programmed to Die,’ Says Nobel Laureate Venki Ramakrishnan

item.title: There’s AI Inside Windows Paint and Notepad Now. Here’s How to Use It
item.description: AI tools have arrived in two of the most basic and long-serving Windows utilities. Here’s what they do and how you can turn them off if you prefer.
